definition: unable to tolerate/intolerant/unable to bear sth
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
can't bear having grit in one's eye (idiom)/unable to put sth objectionable out of one's mind/not prepared to turn a blind eye
pinyin: yan3 li3 rong2 bu5 de2 sha1 zi5

sentences.english: The stage for life is not big enough for us to rush all the way.
sentences.chinese: 人生的舞台并不大，容不得我们一直往前冲。

sentences.english: I would be also very calm, the business origin of affection permit can not the half be some force.
sentences.chinese: 我也会很坦然，感情的事本就容不得半些勉强。

sentences.english: They don't do ambiguity in the White House.
sentences.chinese: 白宫做事容不得一点含糊。

sentences.english: Don't be intolerant of people whose opinions differ from yours.
sentences.chinese: 不要容不得与自己意见不同的人。

sentences.english: Love is really selfish, is also not tolerate any broad-minded.
sentences.chinese: 爱情真的很自私，一点也容不得半点宽阔的胸襟。

sentences.english: And life is too short to waste.
sentences.chinese: 而生命苦短，容不得浪费。

sentences.english: There is no room for prayers in company emails .
sentences.chinese: 公司的电子邮件容不得祈祷者的言辞。

sentences.english: The booming telephone voice cut through his dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 电话中的宏亮嗓音容不得他兀自发窘。

definition: cannot help/to be beyond control of
one thread, one hair (idiom); a tiny bit/an iota
to take into consideration/to attend to
for fear that/lest/also written 惟恐
vitally important/a matter of life and death
